newsitem.title: UK: EBRD broadens trade facilitation programme.
newsitem.headline: EBRD broadens trade facilitation programme.

text.p: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development has broadened a trade facilitation programme to cover all 26 countries the bank operates in, the EBRD said in a statement on Wednesday.
By working with the EBRD, local banks wanting to develop and expand their trade finance capacity can increase access to international correspondent banks, the EBRD said.
"The EBRD's trade facilitation concept supports the development of regional trade and is a strong example of the bank's unique catalytic role in the sector," the statement said.
The total amount available, previously limited to country-specific programmes in Lithuania, FYR Macedonia, Russia, Ukraine and Uzbekistan, was raised by $100 million to $350 million.

"As soon as the local banks started to work within the country programmes, they reported extensive increases in short-term trade finance services, such as unsecured letters of credit confirmation lines, from major international banks, often at highly competitive rates."
